title: Toggle "Target Champions Only"
body:
Hello!

I wanted to propose a way to toggle the hotkey "Target Champions Only".

                  A long time ago, Riot added "locked camera", and many players enjoyed not having to hold the space bar for an extended period of time during a fight.  This change was not for everyone, and many stuck to holding space bar/freely moving the camera.  In my opinion, this change was fantastic because it offered the choice between how you controlled the camera. 

                   Any way, back to the "holding X button for an extended period of time during a fight".  One of my friends was talking to me and was annoyed when unable to hit a champion that was standing behind a tower. I told him about the "Target Champions Only" hotkey, and he began using it. Later he told me that it was annoying to hold the key, and that he was considering buying a new mouse that had additional buttons to make the hotkey more easily accessible. So I thought, why not make the key a toggle so that you can switch between them without holding down the button for a whole team fight? So, I want a checkbox that allows you to make the "Target Champions Only" hotkey able to be a toggle button.

Current Hotkey:
https://i.imgur.com/9c7PmPH.png

Toggle Box Proposed (Example):
https://i.imgur.com/b2priIO.png

Hope you all like this idea!
Will be answering questions in the comments whenever possible. 
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 
Thanks for reading,
Yikés
P.S. wasn't sure if this would go in Story, Art, & Sound or Gameplay, since it fits in both in a way. c:

(Edit: Maybe I should've put this in concepts? Whoops! I've only used the boards a couple of times, sorry!!)

Can you explain how the key works? When im playing ADC and i use the target champions only, do you just hold down the key X while autoing or attack moving?

The hotkey in its current state is a key you hold down and it won't target anything except champions. Say there was a teamfight happening in the middle of a wave, and you were autoing without the key held down. You might accidentally auto a minion, making your damage output against the enemy champions lower. If you hold down the key, your auto attacks would consistently only hit the enemy champions.

My proposal is to make this key an optional toggle so you don't have to hold down the key, but could just turn it on before the fight, and back off after it. Let me know if you have any more questions. :)

PLEASE RIOT!

I would love that to be a thing.

It's extremely uncomfortable to have to hold a button, press attack move, move my character plus press Q W E R

Tell me why people shouldn't just rebind "Champs only" to the T key and use their left index finger for this.

By using the T key this way; you keep your fingers in practically the same position with no noticeable strain, your finger's reach is unaffected (could argue improved since your index would be able to hit 6 easier), and since nearly every targeted ult in the game can't target minions anyway (only exception is Cho'Gath) it's irrelevant that you can't use R+T together.

(Not trying to come off snarky, trying to understand why adding what would look like clumsy toggle mechanism that would require some UI element to track would be a better solution than the one I've been using for years without any issue at all that's so simple to use)

Because it would give people the option. No other reason than appeasing to those who want it. There might be,"better", ways of doing it, but that's the way they want to do it. I don't see any issue with Riot doing that to give player's a full range of options so that they can customize their gaming style instead of forcing them to fit into the already set method.

I came back to this post to find a question already answered for me!  This is really well put, thank-you NaturesMayhem! As NM said, simply for the option of being able to toggle it is what I'm looking for. Much like locked camera, yes you could just learn how to play with it unlocked. However, I personally find it weird to have it unlocked as someone who had never played a MOBA before League. I find the act of holding a key down for the entirety of a fight to be a bit awkward, so I would like to have the option to toggle it. :)
